meanings.definition: To lie in wait or behave in a sneaky or secretive manner.
meanings.sent1: The cat lurks behind the bushes, waiting to pounce on the unsuspecting bird.
meanings.sent2: A sense of danger lurks in the shadows of the old abandoned house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf lurks around the house, playing pranks on everyone.
meanings.sent4: Doubt always lurks in the back of my mind, questioning every decision I make.
meanings.sent5: The mystery novel had a villain who lurks in the dark, adding suspense to the story.

meanings.sent1: A feeling of unease lurks in the empty hallway of the school at night.
meanings.sent2: Hidden dangers lurk beneath the calm surface of the lake.
meanings.sent3: The treasure chest lurks at the bottom of the ocean, waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent4: An air of mystery lurks around the old haunted mansion on the hill.
meanings.sent5: The truth always lurks somewhere, even if it takes time to uncover.

meanings.sent1: The spy lurks in the shadows, gathering information without being seen.
meanings.sent2: A sense of danger lurks as the thief moves silently through the dark alley.
meanings.sent3: The ninja lurks in the night, ready to strike at any moment.
meanings.sent4: Silence lurks in the forest as the predator stalks its prey.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly figure lurks in the mist, haunting the old graveyard.
